data.title: Not your usual "Subway" type Sub Shop
data.text: Loved this quaint little sub shop which had a broad variety of menu options including hot or cold subs.  It's always nice to go to a local, non-chain place, even if you're just looking for a sandwich.  The food was good; the bread fresh.  Service was very friendly, but he was on his own and that meant it took some extra time.  I'd definitely go again, and I think people like the soups which I didn't try. If you're in the downtown area, it is worth your time for a fresh sub.

data.title: Not Thrilled
data.text: Nice shop with good bread & nice service.  The meatball & tuna subs were very good, but the filling (meat) was on the light side. Not sure that I would revisit.

data.title: Cute Place, Average Sandwiches
data.text: This was our first visit to the Sub Shop in Yakima.  This place is a cute shop in downtown Yakima, good atmosphere and clean.  They advertise meats and cheeses sliced to order, which was a plus.  We were the only customers on a Friday evening and ordered two cold sandwiches to go.  Sandwiches tasted good and fresh.  However, they do not give you enough meat.  We could have gone to Subway for the same amount of meat for the same price and were expecting better.  Unfortunately we probably won't go back.

data.title: So Good!!!
data.text: Traveling from Aspen to Seattle, stopped here on the way. This sandwich was exactly what I was in need of. The bread was soft and supple, turkey tasty, and the toppings were crisp and fresh. Highly recommend this sandwich shop for a delicious sub, friendly service and a happy belly.  For a tangy spice, I recommend adding the hot peppers. They are the bomb!

data.title: Great subs with local flavor, gluten-free options!
data.text:
We love the Sub Shop.  The location is quirky-cool, it smells like Grandma's house, and the food is great.  I like the sub and soup combos, and my wife loves the gluten free  Jennie Mae's bread option.  They will take precautions if you have a gluten allergy/intolerance.  Check out the cool old pictures of Downtown Yakima while you're there.  
Get a full, and you'll have enough sandwich for a lunch and a dinner@

data.title: great!
data.text: I did not expect such great subs in a little place like Yakima.  But I was wrong not to have high expectations.  This place is a little treasure trove!  Try the chicken teriyaki sub...outstanding!

data.title: Yummy subs
data.text: Yummy subs, nice people to talk to and good prices! I go whenever I am in the area and it's a good place to meet friends for lunch.

data.title: Best sub shop in town
data.text:
As indicated above I think this is the best sub shop in town. The prices are reasonable and the people who work there are very friendly. They have a huge selection of sandwiches so there is something for everyone.

The only qualification I would have is that they are located downtown so it can get extremely busy around the noon hour and service may be slow then. But then that is true of most places downtown.

This is the place to go for a sub sandwich in Yakima!

data.title: Best sandwiches !
data.text: This place is great . The location on second street in Yakima is amazing . Always great, always fast ! Double stamp Tuesdays help you rack up a freebie quickly . Now I'm craving a number 18!

data.title: Love the Food
data.text: Great subs, nice people.  Ray likes to create unique subs.  Local, family owned business with good food.

data.title: Sub to go
data.text: First visit here nearing lunch time, not crowded, took a Hawaiian sub to go.  Sub was good, service was friendly.  I was second in line to order and was in the door and out again in under 10 minutes.  I'll be back again!

data.title: Great food, so-so service
data.text: The lady that helped me did not seem like she enjoyed her job. She was short with all of us and had a perpetual snarl on her face. They don't have name tags but she is younger with glasses, an orange event security shirt and wore a visor. Other than that, it was good. The food itself is fresh and tasty. I enjoyed the bread. It's a good ratio of bread to filling. Price is right about what the main chains are.. 7.50 got me a #14 half ham turkey and roast beef with chips and a drink. Generally clean place too.

data.title: Good subs!
data.text: You can't beat the friendliness by the owner/operators.  It's the freshest bread and the meat is superb!  You won't be disappointed once you visit.
